attributes.comment:
I would like to ask that the proposed increase in fees for fingerprinting and filing of
the 1600A not be put into effect. I am currently waiting to adopt a baby from
China. We started this process in Dec. 2005. We saved and scrimped and saved
some more. Now we have learned that our savings have to be stretched even
further. We need to re apply to get a new 171H as our old one will expire before
we have a chance to adopt. Unfortunately, if the wait continues to and the pace of
referrals continue as such we are seeing these past few months, we may have to
apply a third time for a new 171H. In order to apply each time, we are required to
update our home study report. This also involves more fees, time taken off from
work and additional appointments and time. I respectfully request that you
consider not raising the fees for the fingerprinting and filing of the 1600A. It would
be one less hurdle for many adopting parents to worry about.

Thank you,

Jennifer Hamilton
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Jennifer Hamilton
